							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Sample Page</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/sample-page__trashed</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Jun 2020 18:31:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:quote -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote"><p>Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like pi&#241;a coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)</p></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>...or something like this:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:quote -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote"><p>The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.</p></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As a new WordPress user, you should go to <a href="https://motorcyclehype.com/wp-admin/">your dashboard</a> to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-06-19 18:31:20]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[sample-page__trashed]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[trash]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_trash_meta_status]]></wp:meta_key>

					<item>
		<title>Privacy Policy</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/privacy-policy</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Jun 2020 18:31:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?page_id=3</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading {"level":1} -->
<h1>Privacy Policy for Doodleish</h1>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>At motorcyclehype.com, accessible from https://motorcyclehype.com/, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by motorcyclehype.com and how we use it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you have additional questions or require more information about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This Privacy Policy applies only to our online activities and is valid for visitors to our website with regards to the information that they shared and/or collect in motorcyclehype.com. This policy is not applicable to any information collected offline or via channels other than this website.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Consent</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>By using our website, you hereby consent to our Privacy Policy and agree to its terms.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Information we collect</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The personal information that you are asked to provide, and the reasons why you are asked to provide it, will be made clear to you at the point we ask you to provide your personal information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you contact us directly, we may receive additional information about you such as your name, email address, phone number, the contents of the message and/or attachments you may send us, and any other information you may choose to provide.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When you register for an Account, we may ask for your contact information, including items such as name, company name, address, email address, and telephone number.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>How we use your information</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We use the information we collect in various ways, including to:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Provide, operate, and maintain our webste</li><li>Improve, personalize, and expand our webste</li><li>Understand and analyze how you use our webste</li><li>Develop new products, services, features, and functionality</li><li>Communicate with you, either directly or through one of our partners, including for customer service, to provide you with updates and other information relating to the webste, and for marketing and promotional purposes</li><li>Send you emails</li><li>Find and prevent fraud</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Log Files</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>motorcyclehype.com follows a standard procedure of using log files. These files log visitors when they visit websites. All hosting companies do this and a part of hosting services' analytics. The information collected by log files include internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet Service Provider (ISP), date and time stamp, referring/exit pages, and possibly the number of clicks. These are not linked to any information that is personally identifiable. The purpose of the information is for analyzing trends, administering the site, tracking users' movement on the website, and gathering demographic information. Our Privacy Policy was created with the help of the&nbsp;<a href="https://www.privacypolicygenerator.info/">Privacy Policy Generator</a>&nbsp;and the&nbsp;<a href="https://www.privacypolicyonline.com/privacy-policy-generator/">Online Privacy Policy Generator</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Cookies and Web Beacons</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Like any other website, motorcyclehype.com uses 'cookies'. These cookies are used to store information including visitors' preferences, and the pages on the website that the visitor accessed or visited. The information is used to optimize the users' experience by customizing our web page content based on visitors' browser type and/or other information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For more general information on cookies, please read&nbsp;<a href="https://www.cookieconsent.com/what-are-cookies/">"What Are Cookies"</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Google DoubleClick DART Cookie</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Google is one of a third-party vendor on our site. It also uses cookies, known as DART cookies, to serve ads to our site visitors based upon their visit to www.website.com and other sites on the internet. However, visitors may choose to decline the use of DART cookies by visiting the Google ad and content network Privacy Policy at the following URL –&nbsp;<a href="https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads">https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Our Advertising Partners</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Some of advertisers on our site may use cookies and web beacons. Our advertising partners are listed below. Each of our advertising partners has their own Privacy Policy for their policies on user data. For easier access, we hyperlinked to their Privacy Policies below.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Google<a href="https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads">https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads</a></li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Advertising Partners Privacy Policies</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You may consult this list to find the Privacy Policy for each of the advertising partners of motorcyclehype.com.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Third-party ad servers or ad networks uses technologies like cookies, JavaScript, or Web Beacons that are used in their respective advertisements and links that appear on motorcyclehype.com, which are sent directly to users' browser. They automatically receive your IP address when this occurs. These technologies are used to measure the effectiveness of their advertising campaigns and/or to personalize the advertising content that you see on websites that you visit.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Note that motorcyclehype.com has no access to or control over these cookies that are used by third-party advertisers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Third Party Privacy Policies</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>motorcyclehype.com's Privacy Policy does not apply to other advertisers or websites. Thus, we are advising you to consult the respective Privacy Policies of these third-party ad servers for more detailed information. It may include their practices and instructions about how to opt-out of certain options.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You can choose to disable cookies through your individual browser options. To know more detailed information about cookie management with specific web browsers, it can be found at the browsers' respective websites.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>CCPA Privacy Rights (Do Not Sell My Personal Information)</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Under the CCPA, among other rights, California consumers have the right to:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Request that a business that collects a consumer's personal data disclose the categories and specific pieces of personal data that a business has collected about consumers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Request that a business deletes any personal data about the consumer that a business has collected.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Request that a business that sells a consumer's personal data, not sell the consumer's personal data.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>GDPR Data Protection Rights</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We would like to make sure you are fully aware of all of your data protection rights. Every user is entitled to the following:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The right to access – You have the right to request copies of your personal data. We may charge you a small fee for this service.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The right to rectification – You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate. You also have the right to request that we complete the information you believe is incomplete.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The right to erasure – You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The right to restrict processing – You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The right to object to processing – You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The right to data portability – You have the right to request that we transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Children's Information</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Another part of our priority is adding protection for children while using the internet. We encourage parents and guardians to observe, participate in, and/or monitor and guide their online activity.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>motorcyclehype.com does not knowingly collect any Personal Identifiable Information from children under the age of 13. If you think that your child provided this kind of information on our website, we strongly encourage you to contact us immediately and we will do our best efforts to promptly remove such information from our records.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>3</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-06-19 18:31:20]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-06-19 18:31:20]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Count quick facts on Dominar 2019</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/count-quick-facts-on-dominar-2019.html</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 23 Feb 2020 18:54:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?p=7</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It never mattered how bad my day is, my&nbsp;<strong>Bike</strong>&nbsp;will always make me feel better!And here is a review on my new DOMINAR 2019, for every bike, maniac out there.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>The quick check o the facts:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>The engine of the new Dominar is much&nbsp;<strong>refined and smooth.</strong></li><li>The 2019 Dominar is a bit upgraded than the older version which offers&nbsp;<strong>USD forks,&nbsp; gear indications and you’ll be getting a double exhaust.</strong>&nbsp;</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>The visibility of the&nbsp;<strong>headlights is apparent,</strong>&nbsp;and you can thoroughly rely on in that case.&nbsp;</li><li>The&nbsp;<strong>handlebar is a bit upright,</strong>&nbsp;so it is very comfortable for the touring purpose rather choosing for a severely long span is<strong>&nbsp;promisingly hasslefree.</strong>&nbsp;</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>Dominar 400 is a<strong>&nbsp;naked sports bike that is made for touring.&nbsp;</strong><img src="https://c.ndtvimg.com/2020-02/83smbt7o_dominar_650x400_28_February_20.jpg"></li><li>The sitting posture for the rider is<strong>&nbsp;very comfortable</strong>, and you don’t need any kind of modifications whereas the sitting posture for the pillion is not that much comforting as it is a little bit narrow, so for pillion rides you can opt for certain modifications in that case. The suspension is also very<strong>&nbsp;comfortable compared to the older version.</strong>&nbsp;</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Experience-based Opinion:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>This is the best bike in this segment as compared to Duke 390 and the BMW G 310 R</strong>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It performs really good on highways and you can&nbsp;<strong>easily cruise&nbsp;</strong>this bike around 135-145km/hr.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You can also meet up your thirst for offroading choosing Dominar. Once you exceed after 5000 rpm the bike,<strong>&nbsp;the bike pulls really fast.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>It is very comfortable for city rides as well.</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The<strong>&nbsp;sound</strong>&nbsp;it produces is also<strong>&nbsp;very decent</strong>&nbsp;and gives a&nbsp;<strong>good bass.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The&nbsp;<strong>clutch and gear</strong>&nbsp;response of the bike is also very<strong>&nbsp;smooth and clear.</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The&nbsp;<strong>fuel efficiency</strong>&nbsp;it gives in the&nbsp;<strong>city is around 19-24kmpl</strong>, and on&nbsp;<strong>highways, it gives a fuel efficiency of 23-27kmpl&nbsp;</strong>(depending on the rider and the road).&nbsp;A coin has two sides, similarly, I would like to exfoliate the other side of the bike which is utmostly extracted from my personal experience.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Listing Down some drawbacks as per my perspective:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So firstly talking about the&nbsp;<strong>tank instrument panel&nbsp;</strong>I think the information which is given should have been given on the main display so that it could get much easier for the rider to look into.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As well as it is also&nbsp;<strong>not very safe</strong>&nbsp;to look down and again up at the same time while riding because of all the information given in the tank instrumental panel is very<strong>&nbsp;important like the gear indicators, the time and the odometer.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And if a rider puts a tank bag on their tank that is going to<strong>&nbsp;block the parameters provided.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Now talking about the<strong>&nbsp;vibrations,</strong>&nbsp;Bajaj has tried to remove vibrations on the new Dominar, and yes it is<strong>&nbsp;reduced but not obliterated. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>While cruising&nbsp;<strong>at 6000-6500 rpm</strong>, you will slightly get few&nbsp;<strong>vibrations from the handlebar,</strong>&nbsp;but it is bearable.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The other important feature which I&nbsp;<strong>personally did not like&nbsp;</strong>about the new Dominar is its<strong>&nbsp;rear brake</strong>, and I think the bajaj needs to look into the matter.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>I hope this comes to help, and all I shared is my personal experience and would love to come back with some more such articles! Stay tuned, and enlist your queries (if you have any) in the comment section below.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<title></title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/20.html</link>

					<item>
		<title>I LIVE AS I RIDE!</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/i-live-as-i-ride.html</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 26 Feb 2020 05:44:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?p=22</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Why are you so crazy about motorcycles? Why do you waste so much time and money after that two-wheel? So much effort after a bike! You will regret it! Don’t you feel bad investing so much petrol and loitering around with your bike?</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><br>These are a few very common statements I face when expressing my unconditional love for motorcycles. I am pretty much sure we have a hundred out there who face the same drudgery as me.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It is so difficult to make the other person understand the essence of the breeze that smoothens your soul as you ride your fuel charged unicorn.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I feel like, my soul charges up as I choose to go out on early weekend mornings, I choose to filter my heart and soul riding to some unknown outskirts on my ride on.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Allover the feel, the zest is inexpressible.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I feel riding takes effort, especially compared to driving a car.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Not only it’s a physical and mental workout it also increases the person's sensitivity.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Motorcycles have always had a certain appealing and glamorous presence, and that is why there have always been people, wanted to get to the root of that feeling.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><br>Motorbikes might not have anything to do with your life, but it helps me to get through the problems of my life, giving me an amazing weekend life as well as being my everyday traffic trauma partner.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I feel there are a lot of you who feel the same.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let’s unite through the best. Drop a comment if you really agree with this. As I feel disturbed,</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>I choose it as my wing to reach the heights to attain peace, also as divers to dive the ocean of reincarnation.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>22</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[i-live-as-i-ride]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="for-beginners"><![CDATA[For Beginners]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[23]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>KTM Adventure 390- The Complete Package</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/ktm-adventure-390-the-complete-package.html</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Mar 2020 05:56:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?p=26</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Good things do take time and the better thing is here, KTM 390 is here with some amuses.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>I have highlighted the aspects whichever I felt was worth highlighting, skip it at your own risk!</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Being much interested in bikes, I have personally witnessed a lot of craze about the newly launched<strong>&nbsp;KTM 390 ADVENTURE!</strong>&nbsp;So here I decided to come up with the review after personally visiting the KTM outlet and the blog is utterly based on the personal opinion! I sincerely hope this helps you.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Does anyone read this has ridden a duke 390? In case, if you have or haven’t let me tell you, the 390 adventure<strong>&nbsp;exactly feels the same&nbsp;</strong>in fact the&nbsp;<strong>BS6 has been incorporated</strong>&nbsp;and the vibrations have been reduced and have become a lot less quite. It weighs 162kg (dry) which makes it<strong>&nbsp;13kg heavier than the duke 390.</strong>&nbsp;The seat height of the 390 adventure is 855mm and it is<strong>&nbsp;25mm taller than the duke 390. The handlebar is upright and feels agile in the corners and it absolutely doesn’t feel slow or sluggish.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Well, the duke 390 adventure comes with many power parts like the&nbsp;<strong>GPS Bracket, Aluminium Sprocket, Helmet Lock, Fork Protectors, Handlebar Brace, Headlight Protector.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There is no sign of adjustable suspension.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The new<strong>&nbsp;twin fan curved radiator</strong>does a better job than the duke and the&nbsp;<strong>heat deflectors</strong><strong>&nbsp;built in the radiator shrouds divert hot air from your legs</strong>&nbsp;<strong>and even in jam traffic the bike never got uncomfortably hot</strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It has got<strong>&nbsp;switchable ABS</strong>which is very essential and helpful for the people who are gonna use this bike for both purposes.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Again it has got&nbsp;<strong>corner ABS</strong>&nbsp;which will help you gain more trust on your motorcycle while cornering.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For its<strong>&nbsp;commanding riding position,</strong>&nbsp;the tall seat height and its wide handlebar make you feel riding a much bigger motorcycle.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>But actually the bike is<strong>&nbsp;slim&nbsp;</strong>so it helps you easily go through traffic.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>The long list of premium features and a ride setup that offers the convenience of the daily commute and highway touring makes the duke 390 adventure much practical.&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Now coming to its adventure part, well if you decide to take this bike for<strong>&nbsp;hardcore off-roading&nbsp;</strong>which involves steep rocky climbs, things can get a bit tricky. It won’t be able to hop like the KTM 450 rally rider, but still, to some extent, you can do a&nbsp;<strong>decent level of off-roading&nbsp;</strong>and will enjoy this motorcycle.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Now coming to the next part where many people have the same question, which is better the<strong>&nbsp;390 adventure or the Royal Enfield Himalayan</strong>? Well, the Himalayan is much more off-road bias bike with its longer travel suspension and greater ground clearance but its also the heavier bike and it just doesn’t match the<strong>&nbsp;raw power of the KTM&nbsp;390 adventure</strong>. Taking consideration of all the toys which this bike offers for off-roads and it does justify the one odd lack excess rupees that it demands.<strong>&nbsp;Even it is Rs 64000 lesser than the BMW GS 310 making it a tempting buy.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>I think KTM 390 Adventure completely justifies the title of the best adventure motorcycle in this country at the moment.</strong>while there are more motorcycles which are more affordable and have got better suspension travel and got easier to ride on off-roads but they are not just nearly this motorcycle on the roads and none of them is a complete package as a bike to go out on and discover new places andlive the definition of adventure.&nbsp;<strong>The 390 adventure hits a sweet spot.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Husqvarna Vitpilen 250 - The Retro Cafe Racer</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/husqvarna-vitpilen-250-the-retro-cafe-racer.html</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Apr 2020 06:04:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?p=29</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>How about a Retro Cafe Racer with some exclusive features in the Indian market?&nbsp;Hey, everyone, we all know that big things come in small packages. So today here, I am going to put down something interesting for all the bikers out there. You all must have known that&nbsp;<strong>Husqvarna&nbsp;</strong>was a maker of dirt bike but surprisingly they have come out with the making of&nbsp;<strong>Vitpilen 250 and the Svartpilen 250&nbsp;</strong>and they are<strong>&nbsp;Not Dirt</strong>&nbsp;bike at all.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><br>Husqvarna bikes will be&nbsp;<strong>available on KTM</strong>&nbsp;showrooms. Now talking about the bike Husqvarna Vitpilen250 is not just a cafe racer bike in the segment but also it’s one of the<strong>&nbsp;first Huskies to land in the Indian two-wheeler market.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Unlike the Svartpilen 250, the Vitpilen 250 is a cafe racer with an&nbsp;<strong>aggressive and sporty stance</strong>. For those who don’t know that Viptilen stands for White arrow.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><br>Husqvarna 250 is a commuter bike that is<strong> priced at 1,79,456</strong> (ex-showroom). It weighs 154kg (dry) and has a tank capacity of 9.5litres.<strong> KTM shares the same Duke 250 engine with the Husqvarna</strong>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You can expect a mileage of 28-30km/pl the same as the duke 250. Husqvarna Vitpilen 250 generates&nbsp;<strong>29.2 bhp of power and 24nm of torque from its engine</strong>. It has a single-cylinder and has a&nbsp;<strong>6speed manual gearbox</strong>. It comes with a<strong>&nbsp;BS 6 engine</strong>&nbsp;and is fuel injected the same as the KTM Duke 250.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Husqvarna Vitpilen 250 has got an&nbsp;<strong>anti-locking braking system</strong>&nbsp;with both front and rear disc brakes. In terms of looking it is designed as a&nbsp;<strong>retro cafe racer&nbsp;</strong>and a<strong>&nbsp;modern street bike&nbsp;</strong>and capable of seeking a lot of attention. It sports a round headlamp which is a full LED unit.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It has got145mm of ground clearancewhich is not much and can be an issue while facing the speed breakers. It also got a switchable ABS which has two modes&nbsp;<strong>The Road and The Super Moto mode</strong>. It gives a very comfortable sitting position for the rider and the pillion but the pillion won’t be comfortable on long rides.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And also the seat height is 5mm taller than the KTM Duke 250. And the other hardware components of the bike like the Engine, frame, suspension, and brakes are the same as the KTM duke 250.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The engine of the Husqvarna 250 is loaded with power and&nbsp;possibly is one of the most&nbsp;<strong>comfortable cafe racers</strong>. It inspires a lot of confidence and you will just want to push more.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>In terms of rivalry, it clashes with the Bajaj Dominar 250, KTM Duke 250, Yamaha FZ25, and the Suzuki Gixxer 250.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Nevertheless, it arrives as a cafe racer-inspired designed and is expected to have humongous appreciation.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_content_score]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[30]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>My First Motorcycle Ride - Travel Diaries &#124; Feeling of Love</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/my-first-motorcycle-ride-travel-diaries-feeling-of-love.html</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 18 Apr 2020 06:13:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?p=32</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>How many of you reading this would agree that once you get the real taste of passion, the passion converts itself into an addiction! Travelling, biking, riding to me is such an addictive thing! Once you start with it there barely any stop at it!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Travelling is a complicated word itself, as it can be a journey of purpose or without a purpose, just to soak your soul free and feel the good vibe about life.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Basically, here I used the word travelling to signify the second meaning to the word mention inline&nbsp;above.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Travelling is a kind of addiction to create&nbsp;good memories to cherish for life. It reveals a whole new exciting world out. It inspires you to open out your inner strength and presents with spectacular adventures.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Destination less travel or thoughtful travel is well worth the time and money. It opens the wonder of&nbsp;the world in so many ways and it helps you appreciate and connect with nature and different cultures. And also it helps to connect you with different people around the world.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For some people, travelling and exploring is the best way to have fun. Overwhelmed enough I am one of those some people.&nbsp; If a travel tour is well planned it can be amazing leisure, refreshment, and knowledge gathering.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To me, travelling does not always need to be a well-known destination, but it can be nearby outskirts or a long road trip. The mode of transportation is not always supposed to be a train or an aeroplane, a bus, care or a motorcycle isn’t a bad choice to enjoy, experience and explore.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Like many of you, I am also a peripatetic. A peripatetic is someone who loves to travel.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Since childhood has travelled a lot with family, vacations, weekends, short trips. Previously things were simple, just like session break or summer holidays from school simply meant it was vacation time, time to take a break from my not too complicated and my parents super happening lives.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>With time my love for travelling is consistent but has become more addictive and adventurous. I love travelling and exploring new places but the twist emerges in my likeliness that roads I travel are on my motorcycle.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The ride on gives me a different kind of inexpressible pleasure and its super fun and satisfying. But my parents don’t like it much and I was even scolded much when I initially told my parents that I want to go around for some tour for a day or two with my motorbike. Initially, I used to go out stealthily, without informing my parents. But later told them everything about how serious I was about it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Trust me this is one of the most daring things I have ever done in my life. Firstly, it's because I did something big for the first time and secondly I took a stand for something I really love.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As far as I remember it was approximately 3 and a half years back when I planned and successfully went on a distant place on my two-wheeler for the very first time and right from there my motorcycle diaries gained a pace. Yet today, I could recall every minute incident which happened on that very day.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A crazy adventure ride, and after so many such rides I can still as it as one the best.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The evening before the ride day where my friends and I decided that we will be going around 50kms from my house for a short spin and our travel destination was a river-side named Diamond Harbour. It is an outskirt of Kolkata.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Before that, I never went for any ride on my motorcycle and it was just random that we went because we just wanted to have an experience that how it feels when you travel with your motorcycle.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It was scheduled at&nbsp; 3:30 am in the morning when we planned to leave for the master plan’s execution from our house as our main aim was to reach before the sunrise and witness the sun rising above the line of horizon casting its reflection on the clear water of mother Ganga.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Nothing ever got me punctual, how could this! So near about 3:45 am in the morning I left my house as cautiously and stealthily as possible. How I managed to elope with my bike was another remarkable incident.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Me and 5 of my friends were all set to start our first ever thrilling ride.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Empty roads could look so mesmerizing was just beyond my thoughts, until I experienced the amazing visionary. The headlight falling straight on the smooth, dark roads are too fantastic to be described in words.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After covering around 20km we entered a village and even there were no lights and far away there were no residential houses too.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Initially, I was a little nervous and scared, as my parents had no knowledge of this activity of mine. But later everything was erased off by the excitement.&nbsp; No sooner did I try to indulge myself totally into the wilderness than&nbsp;there were some cops checking the trucks and after we noticed that we got scared.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And one of my friends shouted, "take a turn!"</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And within a fraction of second, we turned all our motorcycles and we decided to take a different way to our destination.&nbsp;Suddenly I noticed someone saying,</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"stop there".&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I just looked back and no wonder saw a policeman was chasing us with a Scorpio car and we had our hearts in our mouths. Finally, we decided to escape away, unable to think of being caught and the other consequences after that.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So we cruised our motorcycles at a higher speed and somehow we managed to free ourselves from the policeman’s chase.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We stopped at a tea shop. My watch showed 4:35 am when we took our first halt for 15 minutes. I had a cup of tea and started over to travel off the remaining 25-35km. To my surprise, I didn't feel tired at all. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It was mid-December, Foggy all around, the roads were all hazy and the cold early morning north winds shook us a little. But the ambiance where we could hear birds chirping and the feel was way too amazing to type down in words.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I wish I could pause the time and have that amazing feeling going on. It wasn’t much longer when we realized that we have reached our destination. Then I understood the secret source of the pure heavenly cool breeze. We saw a tea shop by the river whose&nbsp;owner&nbsp;was busy preparing for the first-morning tea.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We stopped by the stall sat on a concerted chair on the bank of&nbsp;the river and watched the sunrise.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We took numerous photographs, yet felt like the photographs were too vague in front of the actual scenery. We spoke to the tea shop owner, had&nbsp;a memorable cup of tea, and came to know more about the place. We stayed there for 2-3. How peaceful and calm the place was, couldn't understand how the hours passed so quickly. And then&nbsp;we decided to ride back.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The way back seemed much easy but took us a little more time and made us realize how fun roads would have been without traffic.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The day out, the early morning scene inculcated a strong love for such rides within me. The easy winds, the cool ambiance, the bird’s chirps, and my bike’s headlight show my the road breaking the darkness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is one such day, I will keep stitched with golden thread in my heart forever. Happiness is what all of these indicates. Its never too late to understand what gives you more in life and brings you happiness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After all, it’s all about being happy at the end of the day,&nbsp;addicting people of all age groups. For some people, it’s an opportunity to relax and take a break from their hectic jobs and busy life while to some it is about unwinding the adventurous part of life.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Some people love traveling alone whereas some think it the time of life for creating memories with friends and family. Travelling brings you well being mental relaxation.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="for-beginners"><![CDATA[For Beginners]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_date]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2020-06-20]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[34]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_primary_category]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_metadesc]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[How was your first experience with your motorcycle all alone on roads, read my experience! Thr most trilling ride of my life.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_content_score]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[30]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>What Are The 6 Major Problems Faced By A Lady Biker?</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/major-problems-faced-by-a-lady-biker.html</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 09 May 2020 06:27:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?p=36</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I don’t think it is much unknown to everyone that, motorcycling is a hobby dominated by the masculine section of society. A close glance through reports of research statistics on the men versus women in interest to ride a motorcycle states the follows,</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A prominent YouTuber, who vlogs motorcycling content reports that his analytics convey, his views are dominated by&nbsp;<strong>male viewers by 96.8%</strong>, while it is also worth mentioning that the graph for the lady in consistently seemed to be<strong>&nbsp;moving positively</strong>&nbsp;in the list of viewers over time.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The research claims that 14 percent of women took interest and part to constitute motorcycle riding in the year 2014<strong>,</strong>&nbsp;while in the year 1998, women made up only 7% out of all riders.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So, it is observable that the proportion of women riders have doubled over twenty years, which is really appreciable. What kind of pleasure does Riding a motorcycle bring? Is it only for fun purpose or it has more to it?<strong>&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong><a href="https://motorcyclehype.com/i-live-as-i-ride.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">I Live As I Ride</a>,&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>would be the appropriate&nbsp;<strong>answer to all the queries!</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The fun, adventure, and pleasure of ownership and riding a motorcycle should not be constrained within one half of the society.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It should be open to everyone against all the discriminations and everyone should take much interest in<strong>&nbsp;the pleasure of this insanity!&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>But then there are challenges deceived as problems and issues faced by women motorcycle riders. Of course, not everything in life is as beautiful as a rainbow or smooth as a slide,but to roll on two-wheel it takes a lot of struggle and hurdles to overcome.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Few of the major problems are :</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>1. Societal pressure:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Society embraced the very fact that women should be judged&nbsp;based on looks and must be surrounded by certain societal expectations and specific molds that girls should fit in to. And thus,probably&nbsp;<strong>98% of the society can’t accept&nbsp;</strong>a woman on a motorcycle or flying at speed on two-wheel.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It is observed that boys at their teen-age are often getting access to motorcycles while females would be told that it’s a manly thing to do, and hence thrash their niche thought of joining in and be a women biker.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Even though if someone defies the fact of manly activity and plans to move ahead, eventually the spirit of her paces down for it is really difficult to continuallyfight against judgments and disapproval fears.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>After all, fear is a powerful thing!&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Riding a motorcycle is still seen as a tomboyish thing to do in the modern era of 2020!&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>I wish, Just like a man taking ballet and a woman riding a bike could be perceived by society as a non-gender conforming thing to do.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Thus, a major socio-cultural barrier is a manifest idea that riding or traveling on two-wheel is masculine and elitist. It is a widely shared and promoted perception transmitted by men and women through traditions, beliefs, and social practices.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This entails that women are not meant to be competitive in this certain strata. A further barrier is a false correlation between participation in a particular field with socially unacceptable behaviors.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>2. The second most important issue being</strong>,&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Usually, the interesting section of motorcycle maniac&nbsp;<strong>does not create much space for the inclusion of women riders in the stream.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When a lady walks out to work out of the box eventually becomes distressed, intimidating showing up as one among a number of male motorcycle riders.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Though it is often seen a lady biker shown up for a group ride with her husband or boyfriend.A girl reading solo is rarely witnessed and it is quite difficult for a girl to cope up with a male group.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The very right proverb to sum it up all is,&nbsp;<strong>‘a sheep in a lion’s den’!</strong>&nbsp;And the sheep is much expected to be scared, despite being with safe companions.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>3. Safety issue:&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The issue of safety is predominant to every woman biker in any city.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We all would love an early morning 4 AM ride but would you like to think about the estimated dangers that walk or lurk can bring in our cities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And that’s one big reason no women acquire the&nbsp;<strong>courage to travel solo.&nbsp;</strong>Females do find it relatively safe to ride during the day for shorter distances but they won’t disagree that they,<strong>&nbsp;constantly stay aware of the surroundings</strong>. Daylight does not demotivate a determined yet troubled mind.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>No matter how much we chant on our progressive evolvement, we are stuck in a society where females can neither move around safely be it night or day nor can they trust someone a male completely to chase her passion for life.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>4. Limited bike choice:&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>One of the other major problems experienced by a lady motorcycle rider is, there are only a few bike choices for females.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The main issue arises with the<strong>&nbsp;height of the bike.</strong>&nbsp;Though it isn’t really applicable to all rider because, as in recent times, there is numerous lady rider with short heights and who have really made themselves absolutely fine with tall bikes, amazingly justifying,&nbsp;<strong>‘when there’s a will, there’s a way’</strong>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>However, it is kind of ridiculous, that most female motorcycles are either black or oink or both!&nbsp;<strong>Why is everything pink?</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>5. Limitations in gear selection:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There is always a shortage in choice of gears for women riders, for the gear makers know there is a very small section of women to the entire pie of motorcycle riders.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So they don’t invest much time and energy in female-specific gears.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The color selection for gear is also quite ridiculous as in the case of motorbikes.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Why would a woman<strong>&nbsp;like to scream out her gender&nbsp;</strong>casting it through the color of her jackets, boots, or helmets? &nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Why can’t females have their choices for something they love? Gears for males are easily accessible in all shapes and sizes then why not for ladies? A lady rider opens up in one of her articles stating that</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>‘It’s frustrating to walk into a store and see this great selection of gear for guys, and then there’s little to nothing for women. I get it—we still aren’t the majority and there are a lot more men to cater to than women (for now)’.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>6. The problem of restrooms:</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Unlike men, the necessity of the proper restroom for women travelers is very&nbsp;<strong>much essential</strong>, especially when traveling solo.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Certain health and physical obligations</strong>&nbsp;also serve as a hindrance to the life of a woman who travels.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To add on, it is truly difficult for women to cover a large&nbsp;<strong>distance in one go&nbsp;</strong>while riding a motorcycle,&nbsp;no matter how much we scream for equality it must be accepted that women lag in strength when compared to a man. Though there are exceptions, in that case,&nbsp;<strong>to defy the very truths of life!&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Basically these are a few major issues or problems faced by women riders.&nbsp;</strong>Nevertheless, success comes after conquering over every hurdle. High determination and positivity can only lead to conquer against everything that holds a spirit back.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Amidst all of the problems of a lady biker, it is highly appreciable that the number of females is taking part in the adventure sport and creating a bigger domain with time. What is the kind of satisfaction one receives while riding?&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2><em>I just heard some saying, "<a href="https://motorcyclehype.com/i-live-as-i-ride.html">I Live As I Ride</a>!"&nbsp; I do agree with what she says,&nbsp; do you?&nbsp;</em></h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>36</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-05-09 06:27:00]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-05-09 06:27:00]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[major-problems-faced-by-a-lady-biker]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="women-motorcycle-rider-realm"><![CDATA[Women Motorcycle Rider Realm]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_date]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2020-06-20]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[37]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_primary_category]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_metadesc]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[In recent times, women are scribbling the stereotype thought of motorcycling is a manly thing, despite the major problems. Know what are the problems of female riders.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_content_score]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[30]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[what-are-the-6-major-problems-faced-by-a-lady-biker]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Shayna Texter&#124; The Lady Rider, Who Never Gave Up</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/shayna-texter-the-lady-rider.html</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 May 2020 06:43:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?p=39</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Everythingshe’s accomplished, from making history as the <strong>first female racer to win a Grand National event to getting Red Bull KTM its</strong><strong>first American Flat Track win</strong>, is a result of her perseverance. “It’s all because I didn’t quit. Because I didn’t give up when times got tough. I didn’t give up in 2010, and now I have 16 wins!”&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading {"level":1} -->
<h1><strong>Who is Shayna Texter?</strong></h1>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Shayna Texter&nbsp;is a 28 yeard old girl, whobeats boys at the male-dominated extreme sport, flat-track racing “America’s original extreme sport”.&nbsp;Shayna Texter, an American flat track racer.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>♦How tall is Shayna Texter?&nbsp; What is Texter's&nbsp;weight?</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Shayna Texter is <strong>5 feet tall and weighs less than 100 pounds</strong> and this complete focusses on she completely defies every possible physical barrier.&nbsp;Shayna Texter makes her silhouette grand and impressive in appearance.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>♦<strong>Where is Shayna Texter from?</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Shayna Texter's hometown is Willow Street, Pennsylvania, Constituent state of the United States Of America.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Texter&nbsp;crumbles down a number of so-called superstitions and preconceptions of people about extreme sport and preconceptions about racing. In this niche sport, Texter has garnered mainstream renown for being not only one of two female racers on the professional circuit but one of the most winning, period.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Standing next to her 225-plus-pound Husqvarna motorcycle, the lone female on the flat track race, she looks like an <strong>underdog </strong>amidst all the male flat race riders.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Husqvarna has always been an amaze and still, today holds its prestige today and gets its new retro cafe racer released in 2020, <a href="https://motorcyclehype.com/husqvarna-vitpilen-250-the-retro-cafe-racer.html">The Husqvarna Vitpilen 250</a>, with zero compromises in its look and design.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":40,"width":488,"height":325,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large is-resized"><img src="https://motorcyclehype.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/image.jpeg" alt="" class="wp-image-40" width="488" height="325"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Racing on a dirt oval is in her blood. Texter’s grandfather raced in his younger time of life. Her dad was a flat track racer too! The Texters owns a  Harley Davidson dealership. This is kind of enough to make it acceptable that she started riding at the age of three. Shayna Texter looked up to her dad as an inspiration. It was until 2003 when she had no idea of racing. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In the year 2013, Cory Texter, brother to Shayna Texter started racing flat track. Halfway through the season, Shayna decided to join in on to race, too.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>She improvised by mounting tires from a street bike on her trail bike.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As it didn’t matter that she didn’t have a flat track bike. She lifted her spirit and struggled with all her dedication towards her aim and she was ready to race.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>On that very year, she lost her perfect inspirational source, which is her father. Mr. Texter expired after fighting down cancer in his teenage and then finally surrenders after a lot of struggles against heart and lung disorders.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>“I watched him fight and push, but never give up for my brother and me, and that was just a huge inspiration. On the day he died, we said ‘lets go…we’re going racing.’ It would have been an easy time to walk away from the sport, and I was struggling, but I continued to push.”&nbsp; says, Shayna Texter in one of her interviews.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Shayna Texter’s Career &nbsp;And Achievements:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Despite losing her inspiration, she didn’t break down instead made her motives, ambitions, and dedications stronger.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>In the year 2011, right after a year, she joined racing she showed up at Knoxville Raceway without even a mechanic to help her out. And on that very shot, she stepped ahead in creating the history about ownself by <strong>winning the First Grand National Race.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Achieving the first stone boosted her up, and henceforth she went on to take more wins after her name.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>She records three wins in 2012,&nbsp; succeeded by 3 more in 2013.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image -->
<figure class="wp-block-image"><img src="https://www.americanflattrack.com/storage/app/uploads/public/50f/d88/44e/thumb_61620_1200_800_0_0_auto.jpg" alt=""/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>2017 arrived to be an incredible year to her for she earned 5 wins in a single season.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Shayna Texter, with an assist from Husqvarna, formed her own racing team. Husqvarna, the manufacture’s first official venture in flat track racing.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It was exciting for both the edges, but one that got off to a rocky start.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<img alt="" src="https://press.ktm.com/Content/309462/8d6d93e1-eaf3-4f15-bd45-f58be18915f0/600/1200/.jpg"></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Determination Over Hindrance:&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>First, she had only taken delivery of her new, out of the crate Husqvarna motorcycles. A few days before the first race of the season at<strong> Daytona International Speedway</strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And since AFT Singles machines start out as<strong> 450cc-class motocross bikes, they weren’t set up for flat track racing at all</strong>. Installing the necessities such as 19-inch wheels, tires, handlebars, lowered suspension components, and other bits is a major job, which she and her technician hammered on nearly non-stop for days–days when she could have used to ride and get acquainted with the new bikes.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As it happened, Texter only got about only an hour’s worth of practice on her bike before the <strong>Daytona TT race.</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>To add on to bad luck her custom leather suit–which had just arrived from Italy<strong>–didn’t quite fit.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Texter style, she gave it a go anyway. Despite not being one of the top 18 racers to make the main event, she didn’t let her enthusiasm drain instead, she calmly took it in stride and set her sights on the next race–and so began a season scattered with <strong>both trials and triumphs.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>She took seventh–an improvement,<strong> at the round 2 in Atlanta</strong>, when happened to be after a few weeks.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>At the <strong>Texas Half-Mile in Dallas</strong>, it was clear that her team was getting the bike sorted out, and <strong>she raced to a thrilling second place</strong>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Fans thought and highly expected Texter to bring home the win at the Arizona Mile, but track problems left her with a <strong>disappointing eighth-place finish</strong>. After another <strong>second-place finish in California,</strong> The Sacramento round didn’t treat her much better, and she<strong> didn’t even qualify for the Springfield TT.&nbsp;</strong><strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>But she didn’t quit.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>She was back to fight for<strong> top finishes in Kentucky</strong>. She acquired t<strong>he third place at both the Red Mile and the OKC Mile</strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>But finally, at the Allen County Fairgrounds in Lima, Ohio, known as <strong>the toughest track on the circuit</strong>, she shocked the racing world by taking her <strong>first win of the season.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Her strategy for the win that night?&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>“Hold it wide open and hope for the best!”&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After the amazing win at Lima, Texter raced at the<strong> New York Short Track </strong>and<strong> took 14thplace.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>&nbsp;She failed to qualify for the main event at <strong>the Buffalo Chip TT in Sturgis</strong>, South Dakota. But in just 48 hours she impressively<strong> won a win at the Black Hills Half-Mile.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image -->
<figure class="wp-block-image"><img src="https://www.racingjunk.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Shayna-Texter-action.jpg" alt=""/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>At the Peoria TT, not only did she fail but also faced <strong>a terrible crash.</strong> But for an optimism alike Shayna, it was too timid a reason to stop her.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Could the terrible break at Peoria stop her?</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Four races were left in the season. It took her a lot of hardship with herself for a tenth rank finish at the <strong>Springfield Short Track</strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>At the Williams Grove Half-Mile, a track not far from her hometown and a race attended by loads of family and friends, <strong>she claimed the runner-up spot, </strong>but then finished<strong> seventh at the Minnesota Mile after a bad start.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Meadowlands Mile in New Jersey was a more mile to the race. It was an unfamiliar track, and she had a fight on her hands with fellow racer and “Mile Master” Kolby Carlile. While Carlile got an early break from the pack<strong>, </strong>Texter fought her way through a large group of riders and ran Carlile down. But Carlile wouldn’t back down–and neither would she.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The two fought neck to neck for the lead for more than half of the main event’s 15 laps. Texter, with persisting gentle persuasion just a bit more speed fromher bike on the final straight to<strong> win by a mere 0.006-second.</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Once again, Shayna Texter’s refusal to never give up enabled her to end a rollercoaster season with a marvelous win.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As she finishes the 2018 season on a high note, the offseason held some stirring surprises for Texter:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A ride with the Red Bull KTM Factory Team, the team’s first foray into American Flat Track. With its fingers in<strong> MotoGP, Rally, Enduro, and SX/MX racing, the Red Bull KTM Factory Team</strong> is known for its elite athletes and a culture of winning, and a shot to be on this team is a dream come true for Shayna.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image -->
<figure class="wp-block-image"><img src="https://www.cyclenews.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Red-Bull-KTM-Lima-2.jpg" alt=""/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Conclusion:</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Over the years, Shayna has been establishing herself as one of the top competitors in the sport. She wants other female riders to know that anything is possible and don't let the fact that you are a female hold you back. She is truly admiring and a real-time role model to look up to.  She lifted up the very fact that <strong>‘Nothing comes easy’ </strong>and lived by it. The ride to success is never easy, but giving up should be diminished from life in order to achieve your dreams. In spite of being a girl, she overtook boys in the racecourse as well as achievements shattering down all <a href="https://motorcyclehype.com/what-are-the-6-major-problems-faced-by-a-lady-biker.html">Problems faced by a lady biker</a>.  </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Everything she’s accomplished, from making history as the first female racer to win a Grand National event to getting Red Bull KTM its first American Flat Track win, is a result of her perseverance.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Shayna texter affirms, “It’s all because I didn’t quit. Because I didn’t give up when times got tough. I didn’t give up in 2010, and now I have 16 wins!”&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>And whether it’s on a dirt track or in life, that’s how winning is done!</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		<pubDate>Sat, 20 Jun 2020 08:39:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[doodleish]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1592156956_image_harley-davidson-LUWVMSyNsR4-unsplash.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>76</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-06-20 08:39:52]]></wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[attachment]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
						<wp:attachment_url><![CDATA[https://motorcyclehype.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1592156956_image_harley-davidson-LUWVMSyNsR4-unsplash.jpg]]></wp:attachment_url>
											<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attached_file]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2020/06/1592156956_image_harley-davidson-LUWVMSyNsR4-unsplash.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attachment_metadata]]></wp:meta_key>

		<title>About Us</title>
		<link>https://motorcyclehype.com/about-us</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 20 Jun 2020 11:21:06 +0000</pubDate>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://motorcyclehype.com/?page_id=85</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Motorcyclehype.com is maintained by Doodleish.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Doodleish is a social platform that has been giving and wills to give hundreds of thousands to read, write, and share a vivid variety of blogs, quotes, and doodles. Doodleish was born from creative imagery, for the people who nurture similar interests, from all the corners of the globe. Doodleish is fuelled by its audience who works and enjoys providing content for Doodleish. You need not have to know someone or contribute something to use Doodleish. Our website serves the purpose, where content creators meet their deserved audiences. The creator of creativity meets the creativity seeker through Doodleish. Whether you consider yourself a pro blogger or undegraded blogger, Doodleish stands by you. Doodleish is an emerging roof for like and creative-minded people from hobbyists to professionals and a wide stretch between them. Doodleish aims to become the bridge joining talent and opportunities. It also helps you to get noticed by the corporate world through your blogs. It is one of the most innovative attire that helps you in shaping a better you for the better tomorrow you develop.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
